It's squalid. It smells. It makes me sick. Are you coming with me?
OK.
Bye.
I'd have finished by now, but the police wouldn't let me touch anything. They didn't believe it was suicide.
There was so much blood everywhere.
"She came through here."
"She opened the curtain."
I copied all her actions. The guests were awake all night! The hotel was crawling with cops! They enjoy playing around with blood.
They were all spies! Asking if she was sad, if she was happy, if you fought, how long you'd been married, why you didn't have any children. Pigs!
They got familiar right away! They said, "Your boss is a bit unstable." "Do you know that he was a boxer?" So?
"It didn't work out, so he became an actor." "Bongo player, revolutionary in South America, journalist in Japan."
I say, "Can I clean up now?" "No!
They'll be doing the autopsy right now.
They told me to give you your razor back.
They said they don't need it any more. The investigation is over.
Excuse me, where shall I put this?
The door was open. I'll put it there.
What about the table?
Thank you.
Jeanne REGARDS the room.
She walks across the mattresses with her BOOTS ON. Paul leans against the wall STUDYING THE ROOM.
Jeanne screams BLOODY MURDER and points to a DEAD RAT on the STILL UNMADE MATTRESS.
They pass some GUESTS coming down.
Hi.
Some of the OTHER GUESTS pop their heads out to see what the COMMOTION IS. He gently CLOSES THEIR DOORS in a "mind your own business" sort of way.
Jeanne is on the ELEVATOR. She sticks her head out.
Paul has decided his BED FITS BETTER in here. The BOTTOM MATTRESS is on the floor in the MIDDLE OF THE ROOM. He LEANS AGAINST THE WALL and top mattress, WAITING FOR JEANNE. He knew she'd be there.
JEANNE'S VOICE I'm coming! I'm ready.
Jeanne kneels in front of a HEAD STONE that reads "Mustapha".
Mustapha could always tell the poor from the rich.
If someone well-dressed came in, he never stirred. But if someone scruffy came in, you should have seen him! What a dog!
Give me a kiss.
She was too good. She spoilt you.
I couldn't live in Paris.
Oh, these dirty little Arabs! Go and shit in your own country!
She reads on.
Jeanne has CUM. She ROLLS OFF THE MATTRESSES onto the floor, SPENT.
Jeanne stands with her back turned staring down into the GUN DRAWER.
Rosa's LOVER.
Good evening, madame.
Goodnight, Paul.
Come in!
Do you mind if I carry on working?
It helps me a lot after what has happened.
Identical. Rosa wanted them identical.
Same colour, same pattern.
Hobby? I don't like that word.
Be honest. You didn't know we had the same bathrobes.
We've got a lot of things in common.
Hold on. Here's the bourbon.
I don't really like bourbon, but Rosa wanted me to keep a bottle here in my room.
I was asking myself this question.
For example, a while ago, something happened that I still don't understand. Do you see there, on the wall?
She had climbed onto the bed and she was trying to tear at the walls with her hands. I stopped her because she was breaking her nails.
A cold sore. I don't know. Shit.
Not as much as you.
Yes, I do.
I have a secret.
This is my secret! Thirty times every morning.
Tom and Jeanne sit, ROMANTICALLY ENTWINED on a SEA WALL while his FILM CREW films in the b.g.
Speak up! I can't hear anything.
As it ascends, Jeanne slowly RAISES HER DRESS, revealing NO UNDERWEAR and her AMPLE BUSH to Paul.
Paul is there, WAITING, NONCHALANT.
Here he is.
Hurry up! Wake up! Open up! Open up!
I need room four for a while.
Half an hour?
Yes, that'll do. Yes, half an hour.

That's not true. When you're full, you put a sign outside. I know the hotel. I'm sick of arguing out on the street. Call the owner. What are you waiting for? The owner has never made a fuss. Rosa and I are old friends. Open up.
Don't make any trouble or I'll tell your boss.
You've won. He's taken off.
Hurry up! He can't be far away.
Make him come back. Tell him he can't just walk off.
You're crazy! Let go of me! Let go!
We watch one of the DANCE COUPLES DANCE THE TANGO. We focus on their LEGS and FEET.
We watch a DIFFERENT COUPLE DANCE.
We watch a COUPLE as the MUSIC STOPS. All the PATRONS CLAP as the DANCE floor clears.
And now, ladies and gentlemen, good luck for the last tango!
That's the limit! What are you doing?
You'll have to leave, sir.
Go to the circus if you want to see love! Go on! Get out of here!
She tries to GET THROUGH TO HIM.
He LOOKS OUT upon the city, and UP TO THE SKY. He takes his gum out of his mouth and STICKS IT UNDER THE RAILING.
